newsitem.title: USA: Rational Software to buy Pure Atria.
newsitem.headline: Rational Software to buy Pure Atria.

text.p: Rational Software Corp said on Monday it entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Pure Atria Corp, exchanging 0.90 shares of Rational for each share of Pure Atria.

Rational Software develops, markets and supports a solution which automates the component-based development of software. Pure Atria makes software development automation products which enable Windows, Web and Unix development teams to create and use software applications.

While Rational Software was not immediately available to provide the total value of the purchase, the company said it would take an unspecified one-time charge in the second quarter for merger-related costs.
Separately, Pure Atria said it expected its first quarter revenue and earnings for its first quarter ended March 31 would be below analysts' forecasts.

Pure Atria, which is based in Sunnyvale, Calif., said it expected first quarter earnings to be between about $0.02 per share and $0.04 per share, excluding a one-time charge associated with its acquisition of Integrity QA Software.
The First Call consensus earnings estimate for the first quarter was $0.12 per share compared to $0.09 per share the company earned in last year's first quarter.
Its first quarter revenues would likely be around $30 million, the company said.
Pure Atria, which said it planned to report full results after the market close on April 17, was not immediately available to comment further.
Rational Software said its purchase of Pure Atria was expected to be accounted for as a pooling of interests and to qualify as a tax-free reorganization.
It was set to close in the third quarter, Rational said.
Rational Software said it aimed to create a software company which would operate globally with products to automate the component-based development of software applications.

"By quickly integrating the Pure Atria sales operation into the Rational field sales operation and quickly integrating the industry-leading Pure Atria and Rational products in the context of Rational's proven business model, we are creating in Rational a partner that customers around the world can depend on," Rational chairman Paul Levy said. Levy would remain Rational's chairman.
Pure Atria's main lines of business would become new units within Rational's products group, it said.
Pure Atria Chief Executive Officer Reed Hastings would become Rational's chief technical officer, it said.
Pure Atria and Rational have granted reciprocal options to to buy newly issued shares equal to about 19.9 percent of each of the issuing company's outstanding shares, Rational said.
Outstanding options to buy Pure Atria stock would be converted at the exchange ratio into Rational options, it said.
